text: The Benbow Inn, in Garberville, California, is a hotel built in 1926. It was an early hotel on the Redwood Highway; it was originally called the Hotel Benbow. The Benbow Inn was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1983. It was built of Douglas fir and is Tudor Revival in style. With It is a member of the Historic Hotels of America. ==References== ==External links== * Category:National Register of Historic Places in Humboldt County, California Category:Buildings and structures completed in 1926 Category:Hotels in California Category:Buildings and structures in Humboldt County, California
title: Benbow Inn
